revised_title: Pulsars as Precision Tools for Relativistic Gravity Experiments
tldr: Pulsars are incredibly stable clocks that can be used to study various aspects of physics, particularly relativistic gravity. Pulsar timing observations have confirmed the existence of quadrupolar gravitational waves and provided constraints on the nature of gravity, Newton's constant, and low-frequency gravitational waves in the universe. These findings have significant implications for our understanding of the cosmos and the fundamental forces at play.
